intro: Hybanthus racemifer, commonly known as the clustered hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of yellow flowers with five petals, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are simple, alternate, and usually have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
